Enumerate through dragging items to modify their properties, such as the drag image or size, while the user is dragging. When the dragging items are over the destination, changes that the destination’s
methods make may override changes you make during the drag session.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A set of methods that supply information about a dragging session.
A single dragged item within a dragging session.
The frame of the dragging item.
An array of blocks that provide the dragging image components.
A group of constants that specify options to use when enumerating dragging items.
The encapsulation of a drag-and-drop action that supports modification of the drag while in progress.
Enumerates through each dragging item.
An object that transfers data to and from the pasteboard server.
Options for reading pasteboard data.
Reads from the receiver objects that best match the specified array of classes.
An item on a pasteboard.
A set of methods that defines the interface for initializing an object from a pasteboard.
Returns an array of uniform type identifier strings of data types the receiver can read from the pasteboard and initialize from.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
A true value.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Describes an integer.
A signed integer value type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
The protocol to which all class types implicitly conform.
